abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Urban Project in Botswana was
            achieved. The Bank's interactions at all times
            regarding identification, appraisal and implementation of
            this project were highly valued by the Borrower. The
            Bank's assistance was appreciated on clarifying policy
            questions relating to the appropriate urban tenure
            instruments, cost recovery, pricing and standards. The
            second urban development project financed by the World Bank
            in Botswana has successfully provided urban services to
            approximately 50,000 low to moderate income residents in new
            and upgraded developments. The institutional problems
            encountered during the implementation of this project,
            stemming largely from inadequate arrangements for housing
            have been fully analyzed and documented in the Housing
            Sector Review, 1988. Based on the findings and
            recommendations of this Review, existing agencies would
            continue to play key roles in the housing development
            process, but with a more clearly articulated framework, and
            with areas of responsibility more specifically defined.
